message: And the reddit for it: http://www.reddit.com/r/linguistics/comments/g5qh4/indigenous_tweets_connecting_minority_language/ – there are links to a blog entry by my prof and one by myself talking about the service a bit more

http://indigenoustweets.com/ – something my prof. made; helps members of language communities discover and connect with one another on Twitter by categorizing tweeters into top 500 rankings for each language (35 so far)
Oh, and @brianrourkeboll – noticed you speak Gaeilge. Nice side note that he also speaks it, it often drives a lot of the work he does on this stuff.
and that service is pretty cool

@michaelschade is this your prof's website? - http://borel.slu.edu/ - that's cool that he does a lot of translation work for various free software packages &c. (I myself have done some for things like Facebook, Google, WordPress)
@michaelschade your professor does?
and I've availed myself of the very few linguistics-related courses that are offered at ND
haha yeah
ooh fun, studying?
@brianrourkeboll Yeah, he speaks Gaeilge and that's his site.
http://www.google.com/transconsole/giyl/chooseProject
though it has some unique tools that e.g. Google and WordPress don't offer
(with regards to translation)

mainly because of the frequency of additions and changes (I'm in school right now) and the sheer number of other people competing with you for each translation with their own, which is often wrong &c.

that's why I'm hoping to pool everyone's translation efforts...it's quite silly everyone is translating a lot of the same strings on different platforms, duplicating the work and leaving conflicting translations
Haha I was just thinking about that when I remembered these conversations are indexable by search engines

also, dunno if you saw on Hacker News today, chats.io or whatever (though I'm sure there are other things that provide similar funcitonality) - maybe Convore should use something like that to supplement the forum-like parts of it, so threads don't get horribly off-topic like this one?
Haha haven't seen chats.io either–been busy today, didn't catch my usual news! Will check that out too
Thanks, that's the project we've been working on together. New version coming out soon with live accentuation (accentuates text as you type)
That is weird. The Wikipedia page of my Canadian doppelgänger is the first result for my name :(
re: accentuate.us, that's pretty neat - I'd try it out now except I'm on a Cr-48 with Chrome OS right now
We'll hopefully show Chrome some love soon-ish too (after the Firefox 1.0 add-on). The code is modular enough that it shouldn't be extraordinarily difficult to port
Haha alright. I'll make an effort to pop back in on Convore then at some point. Followed on twitter, btw
I'm looking at accentuate.us now. interesting.
@brianrourkeboll Nice! I know he's done some Facebook translation too. What kind of Google stuff have you done?
oh for the addon? cool
@brianrourkeboll Nice on Google in lang stuff!
and I've just contributed to the "Google in your language" stuff
yeah, although I haven't really done anything on there for a while
recently I've been translating strings from wordpress.com when I've been bored haha
in fact, most of the Irish version of it has been translated by me
I saw the Facebook translate tools recently, they are pretty nice
hmm that sounds interesting, how are you doing that?
working on it as a cross-browser javascript implementation. will let you translate on-site so you can maintain context
yeah, on Facebook it's a voting-type thing
...which may not necessarily be a good thing - I wish there were more interested, competent parties involved that could help

and yeah, you must have seen that topic in the Gaeilge group here on Convore where I talked with @Pangur in Irish - interestingly, I didn't feel weird talking about personal things in public there since it was in Irish...
Didn't see the Gaeilge group topic, will have to go check it out
so mostly Irish language, literature, history stuff
but I kind of gave up on Facebook
translating at sentence-level by breaking pages into them and, if already in the database, providing that, else letting one contribute
Yeah, freshman at SLU
you?
sweet, that sounds awesome
I'm working on a universal translation tool (translate any site on the site, so you're not dependent on them implementing such functionality)

yeah, going to have to tackle that issue myself too--how to decide whose is best, but hopefully some community guidelines in the implementation can get rid of the competition aspect so that's not a problem
See ya!
on WordPress I'm the only person currently translating anything for Irish, and I'm a "validator," so I can have it my way haha
haha--yeah, unfortunately hard to find that
so @michaelschade you're a computer science student?
cool
and yeah, that makes a lot of sense
I'm at Notre Dame
well, self-designed major in "Irish Cultural and Language Studies"
incidentally, have you used Quora at all?
yeah same here, but I've found that my Quora profile page is the first result on Google for my name, which I thought was weird...
:o I should be the third result
haha well I meant your Quora account
haha well with chats.io you can just start a new chat room on the fly, e.g., chats.io/indigenoustweetsthingfromconvore
haha
Nice concept, will have to keep an eye on that one

also, I haven't really used Convore that much... it's kinda weird in that it can feel like a relatively private interpersonal chat sort of thing, while it's actualy relatively permanent and visible to the public! haha
felt like I was IMing privately with you
I've poked around it, setup an account and all, but haven't really gotten into it. You?
well, with my ful name. I just searched for you and you're a third the way down the page of 100 results http://www.google.com/search?sourceid=chrome&ie=UTF-8&q=michael+schade&qscrl=1

though I recall that sort of thing (i.e., plain-old chat) being requested in Google Wave when it was around even though you could see other parties' messages as they were being typed - it was never added
yeah, though I rarely use Twitter (haha I'm not on the Gaeilge list on indigenoustweets)
twitter.com/ceadite though
@brianrourkeboll Sorry, rest of family got home. Gotta run for now, but hope to chat more later. You on Twitter or anything like that (I pay more attention to that than Convore, typically)
haha now they have this: http://blog.convore.com/post/4564081661/private-messages
@brianrourkeboll Haha, yeah I saw that and actually thought back to this conversation!
